编辑注释: ［注：《This　difference　in　the　degree　of　durability　of　fixed　capital，and　this variety　in　the　proportions　in　which　the　two　sorts　of　capital　may　be combined．》――《原理》第25页。］

编辑注释: ［注：《The　proportions，too，in　which　the　capital　that　is　to　support　labour，and　the　capital　that　is　invested　in　tools，machinery，and　buildings，may　be　variously　combined．》――同上。］

编辑注释: ［注：《The　food　and　clothing　consumed　by　the labourer，the　buildings　in　which　he　works，the　implements　with　which　his labour　is　assisted，are　all　of　a　perishable　nature．There　is，however，a　vast 　difference　in　the　time　for　which　these　different　capitals　will　endure：a  steam-engine　will　last　longer　than　a　ship，a　ship　than　the　clothing　of the　labourer，and　the　clothing　of　the　labourer　longer　than　the　food　which he　consumes．》――李嘉图《原理》第26页。］

编辑注释: ［注：《According　as　capital　is　rapidly　perishable　and　requires to　be　frequently　reproduced，or　is　of　slow　consumption，it　is　classed　under the　heads　of　circulating，or　fixed　capital．》］

编辑注释: ［注：《A　division　not essential，and　in　which　the　line　of　demarcation　cannot　be　accurately drawn．》］

编辑注释: ［注：《论影响社会上劳动阶级状况的环境》1817年伦敦版。有关的一段在第一卷第655页注（79）引用过[59]。］

编辑注释: ［注：《It　is　also　to　be　observed　that　the　circulating　capital　may　circulate，or　be　returned　to　its　employer，in　very　unequal　times．The　wheat　bought　by　a　farmer　to　sow　is　comparatively　a　fixed　capital　to　the　wheat　purchased　by　a　baker　to　make　into　loaves．The 　 one　leaves　it　in　the　ground，and　can　obtain　no　return　for　a　year；the　other　can　get　it　ground　into　flour，sell　it　as　bread　to　his　customers，and　have　his　capital　free，to　renew　the　same，or　commence　any　other　employment　in　a　week．》（第26―27页）］
